refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This is a palm conduit to fetch, install, or remove, Foto files from a Palm. It can also convert *.jpg.pdb files that have already been fetched from the Palm to jpeg files.

listitem.para: Delete all, or named fotos from handheld.
Install one, or many jpeg images to handheld.
List all jpeg files and thumbnails on handheld.
Fetch all jpeg files, or certain ones by name.
Tries to detect if a file really is a jpeg and refuses to install it, if it is not.

refsect1.para: pilot-foto allows you to do multiple operations in one sync. For instance, delete test.jpg and install test.jpg.

blockquote.para: Delete a jpg file on the handheld
Delete ALL jpg files on the handheld
Fetch ALL jpg files from the Palm

Use device file port to communicate with the Palm handheld. If this is not specified, pilot-foto will look for the $PILOTPORT environment variable. If neither are found or supplied, pilot-foto will print the usage information.
Display version of pilot-foto and exit without connecting.
Display the help synopsis for pilot-foto and exit without connecting.
Display a brief usage message and exit without connecting.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.programlisting: Examples: pilot-foto -p /dev/pilot -f pilot-foto -d MyImage.jpg pilot-foto -i MyImage.jpg pilot-foto -i *.jpg pilot-foto -f MyImage pilot-foto -c MyImage.jpg.pdb

listitem.para: Palm has not published their database format for the thumbnails. So, pilot-foto puts a generic penguin thumbnail for every image uploaded. Fotos can be accessed by a named list on the handheld as well as the thumbnails. This has been tried on a couple of handhelds. It is possible that a foreign palm or different model will not like it.
To get a thumbnail image you can copy the jpegs to the memory card. If you copy them back to the handheld they will have a new thumbnail that matches the jpeg.

refsect1.title: Author
refsect1.para: This manual page was written by Neil Williams linux@codehelp.co.uk

listitem.para: If a jpeg is installed with the same name as one already on the palm you will have 2 thumbnails pointing to the same jpeg. The new jpeg will overwrite the old jpeg.
If the thumbnail fails to install then the jpeg should be removed. It is not.
